channel.title: How do you know your X and Y cords?
channel.description: Ok when i log into the mopar client to find my starting place, i type it so my coords show all i get are 2 coords. Are these the x cords or y coords and if they are one of them, how do i get my (y) or coords or x coords?

item.title: How do you know your X and Y cords?
item.dc:creator: @WhoOwnzJava WhoOwnzJava
item.description:
@WhoOwnzJava wrote:

F4 on mopar client

Read full topic

item.title: How do you know your X and Y cords?

item.description:

Remember X is always first, Y is always last. Just like the alphabet.

@jmz43 wrote:

type ::coordson and to off ::coordsoff

item.title: How do you know your X and Y cords?
item.dc:creator: @Murakoo Murakoo
item.description:
@Murakoo wrote:

Yea now i understand that but look what i get when i try to change the player location…

// initial x and y coordinates of the player heightLevel = 0; // the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper initialization packet teleportToX = 3254;//3072; teleportToY = 3420;//3312;

I only see 2 coords on the bottom of my screen where do i put them in like for example, i get coords 2344, 3243. Do i put these in x or y and if i pu tthem in x what do i put for y

Read full topic
item.source: How do you know your X and Y cords?

item.title: How do you know your X and Y cords?
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Or you can type ::coordson

item.source: How do you know your X and Y cords?

item.title: How do you know your X and Y cords?
item.dc:creator: @Ultimacool Ultimacool
item.description:
@Ultimacool wrote:

It’s like this.

(XXXX)(YYYY)

and your only supposed to get 2 coords so that is it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you know your X and Y cords?

item.title: How do you know your X and Y cords?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

On the bottom right corner there is a run icon. If you click that, you should see your coords at the top. Also, typing in the command “::coords” should turn them on so you can see them right above the chat box.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you know your X and Y cords?
